text: Therefore in a case where Explanation 2 is re sorted to the identity of the company or the association or the collection of persons must be established so as to be relatable to the defamatory words or imputations
label: ANALYSIS

text: Where a writing inveigh against mankind in a general or against a particular order of men e g men of own it is no libel
label: ANALYSIS

text: It must descend to particulars and individual to make it a libel 1
label: ANALYSIS

text: In England also
label: ANALYSIS

text: criminal proceedings would lie in the case of libel against a class provided such a class is not indefinite e g men of science
label: ANALYSIS

text: but a definite one such as the clergy of the diocese of Burham the 1 1699 3 Balk 224 cited in Ratanlal and Dhirajlal Law of Crimes 23nd ed 1317 justices of the peace for the county of Middlesex
label: ANALYSIS

text: see Kenny s Outlines of Criminal Law 19th ed 235
label: ANALYSIS

text: If a well defined class is defamed every particular member of that class can file a cornplaint even if the defamatory imputation in question does not mention him by name
label: ANALYSIS

text: In this connection counsel for the appellants leaned heavily on K
label: PRE_RELIED

text: nupffer v London Express Newspaper Ltd 1
label: PRE_RELIED

text: The passage printed and published by the respondents and which was the basis of the section there read as follows The quislings on whom Hitler flatters himself he can build a pro German movement within the Soviet Union are an emigre group called Hlado Russ or Young Russia
label: PRE_RELIED

text: They are a minute body professing a pure Fascist ideology who have long sought a suitable Fuehrer I know with what success
label: PRE_RELIED

text: The appellant a Russian resident in London brought the action alleging that the aforesaid words had been falsely and maliciously printed and published of him by the respondents
label: PRE_RELIED

text: The evidence was that the Young Russia party had a total membership of 2000 that the headquarters of the party were first in Paris but in 1940 were shifted to America
label: PRE_RELIED

text: The evidence however showed that the appellant had joined the party in 1928 that in 1935 he acted as the representative of the party and as the head of the branch in England which had 24 members
label: PRE_RELIED

text: The appellant had examined witnesses all of whom had said that when they read the said article their minds went up to the appellant
label: PRE_RELIED

text: The House of Lords rejected the action Lord Simon saying that was an essential element of the cause of action in a libel action that the words complained of should be published of the plaintiff that where he was not named the test would be whether the words would reasonably lead people acquainted with him to the conclusion that he was the person referred to
label: PRE_RELIED

text: The question whether they did so in fact would not arise if they could not in law be regarded as capable of referring to him and that was not so as the imputations were in regard respect of the party which was in Paris and America
label: PRE_RELIED

text: Lord Porter agreed with the dismissal of the action but based his decision on the ground that the body defamed had a membership of 2000 which was considerable a fact vital in considering whether the words in question referred in fact to the appellant
label: PRE_RELIED

text: The principle laid down here was that there can be no civil action for libel if it relates to a class of persons who are too numerous and unascertainable to join as plaintiffs
label: PRE_RELIED

text: A single one of them could maintain such an action only if the words complained of were published of the plaintiff that is to say if the words were capable of a conclusion that he was the person referred to
label: PRE_RELIED

text: see Gatley on 1 1944 A C 116 348SupCI 73Libel and Slander 6th ed 288
label: PRE_RELIED

text: Mr Anthony however was right in submitting that the test whether the members of a class defamed are numerous or not would not be apt in a criminal prosecution where technically speaking it is not by the persons injured but by the state that criminal proceedings are carried on and a complaint can lie in a case of libel against a class of persons provided always that such a class is not indeterminate or indefinite but a definite one
label: PRE_RELIED

text: Kenny s Outlines of Criminal Law 19th ed 235
label: PRE_RELIED

text: It is true that where there is an express statutory provision as in s 499 Expl 2 the rules of the Common Law of England cannot be applied
label: PRE_RELIED

text: But there is no difference in principle between the rule laid down in Explanation 2 to s 499 and the law applied in such cases in England
label: PRE_RELIED

text: When therefore Expl 2 to s 499 talks of a collection of persons as capable of being defamed such collection of persons must mean a definite and a determinate body
label: PRE_RELIED

text: This was the construction of Expl 2 to s 499 adopted in Sahib Singh Mehra v U P 1 and which guided the decision in that case
label: PRE_RELIED

text: The article complained of there was one printed and published in the appellant s newspaper called Kaliyug of Aligarh which contained the following How the justice stands at a distance as a helpless spectator of the show as to the manner in which the illicit bribe money from plaintiffs and defendants enters into the pockets of public prosecutors and assistant public prosecutors and the extent to which it reaches and to which use it is put
label: PRE_RELIED

text: This Court held that the prosecuting staff of Aligarh and even the prosecuting staff in the State of U P formed an identifiable group or collection of persons within the meaning of s 499 Expl 2 in the sense that one could with certainty say that a group of persons has been defamed as distinguished from the rest of the community and therefore a complaint by the Public Prosecutor and eleven Assistant Public Prosecutors was a competent complaint
label: PRE_RELIED

text: Following the test laid down in this decision
label: PRE_RELIED

text: the High Court of Allahabad in Tek Chand v R K Karanjia 2 held that the Rashtriya Swayam Sevak was a definite and an iden tifiable body that defamatory imputations regarding it would be defamation within the meaning of s 499 Exp 2 that such imputations would be defamation of the individual members of that body or class and that a complaint by an individual member of such a body was maintainable
label: PRE_RELIED

text: see also the dictum of Kendall J in Wahid Ullah Ansari v Emperor 3 1 1965 2 S C R 823 828 2 1969 Cr L J 536 3 A I R 1935 All 743
label: NONE

text: This being the position in law the question upon which these appeals must be decided is which was the class or body in respect of which defamatory words were used and whether that body was a definite and an identifiable body or class so that the imputations in question can be said to relate to its individual components enabling an individual member of it to maintain a complaint
label: ANALYSIS

text: The High Court after citing Tek Chand s case 1 went on to say that the Dravida Kazhagam was an identifiable group that the respondent was an active member of that body that he was also the chairman of the reception committee of the conference and that he was one of those who piloted and sponsored the resolution which was said to have been wrongly reproduced and distorted in the news item in question
label: ANALYSIS

text: Apart from the fact already mentioned by us earlier that neither the complaint nor the evidence of the respondent indicated that the resolution was piloted by him the news item nowhere referred to or even mentioned the Dravida Kazhagam
label: ANALYSIS

text: As already pointed out the conference was a body distinct from that party having its own Organisation its own secretaries who dealt with the correspondence to and by the conference and its own office where its work was conducted
label: ANALYSIS

text: No doubt the conference was organised by the Dravida Kazhagam but that would not mean that both were the same or that the members of the Dravida Kazhagam and those of the conference or those who attended it were the same
label: ANALYSIS

text: Indeed the principal function of the reception committee would be to enroll members of the conference and thus collect funds to defray its expenses
label: ANALYSIS

text: In fact the evidence of the respondent indicated that the conference was attended not only by the members of the Dravida Kazhagam but also by outsiders who included as many as 5000 women
label: ANALYSIS

text: It is therefore wrong to identify one with the other or to say that defamation of the conference as a class or collection of persons was the defamation of the Dravida Kazhagam
label: ANALYSIS

text: That was not and indeed could not be the case of the respondent
label: ANALYSIS

text: The news item complained of clearly stated that the resolu tion was passed by the conference and not by the Dravida Ka zhagain
label: ANALYSIS

text: In his very first letter dated January 28 1971 which the respondent signed describing himself as the chairman of the reception committee and not as an important member of the Dravida Kazhagam the respondent complained that the news item had distorted the resolution passed by the conference and asked the editor to publish his correction and clarification of that resolution
label: ANALYSIS

text: There is no grievance there that the Dravida Kazhagam suffered injury in reputation or otherwise by that alleged 1 1969 Cr L J 536 distortion
label: ANALYSIS

text: In his advocates letter dated February 1 1971 the respondent s complaint was that the news item was highly defamatory and had tarnished the image of the conference of whose reception committee he was the chairman
label: ANALYSIS

text: In his evid ence before the Magistrate also as clearly stated that the resolution was the resolution moved by the president of the committee and passed by the conference
label: ANALYSIS

text: Thus his case throughout was that the publication of the said resolution reported in the said news item in a distorted form had tarnished the image not of the Dravida Kazhagam but of the conference
label: ANALYSIS

text: That being so the High Court completely missed the real issue viz whether the conference was a determinate and an identifiable body so that defamatory words used in relation to the resolution passed by it would be defamation of the individuals who composed it and the respondent as one such individuals and chairman of its reception committee could maintain a complaint under s 500 of the Penal Code
label: ANALYSIS

text: Whether the Dravida Kaghagam was an identifiable group or not was beside the point for what had to be decided was whether the conference which passed the resolution in question and which was said to have distorted was such a determinate body like the Rashtriya Swayam Sevak in Tek Chand s case or the body of public prosecutors in Sahib Singh Mehra s case 1 as to make defamation with respect to it a cause of complaint by its individual members
label: ANALYSIS

text: In our view the High Court misdirected itself by missing the real and true issue arising in the applications before it and deciding an issue which did not arise from those applications
label: ANALYSIS

text: The judgment of the High Court based on an extraneous issue therefore cannot be sustained
label: ANALYSIS

text: In this view of the matter we would have ordinarily remanded the case to the High Court
label: RATIO

text: But such a procedure appears to be unnecessary as in our view the conference was not such a determinate class like the one in the cases referred to earlier where complaints by its individual member or members were held maintainable
label: RATIO

text: It is impossible to have any definite idea as to its composition the number of persons who attended the ideas and the ideologies to which they subscribed and whether all of them positively agree d to the resolution in question
label: RATIO

text: The evidence simply was that the person presiding it read out the resolution and because no one got up to oppose it was taken as approved of by all
label: RATIO

text: The conference clearly was not an identifiable or a definitive body so that all those who attended it could be said to be its constituents who if the conference was defamed would in their turn be said to be defamed
label: RATIO

text: 82In these circumstances and for the reasons set out above we allow these appeals set side the order of the High Court and quash the proceedings taken out by the Magistrate on the ground that the respondents compaint was not competent
label: RPC

text: V P S Appeals allowed
label: RPC

text: IN THE COURT OF JUDICIAL MAGISTRATE FIRST CLASS ROURKELA Present Sri P K Sethi LL M J M F C Rourkela
label: PREAMBLE

text: Dated this the 22nd day of June 2015 2 a CC No 656 of 2002 Trial No 30 of 2014 STATE
label: PREAMBLE

text: Prosecution VERSUS Munia Puran aged about 41 yrs
label: PREAMBLE

text: W O Durga Puran AT Turiberna P S Lathikata District Sundargarh Accused Offence U s 47 a of the B O Excise Act Counsel for the prosecution Suresh Chandra Majhi A P P Rourkela
label: PREAMBLE

text: Counsel for the defence U K Pandey Associates Rourkela
label: PREAMBLE

text: Date of conclusion of argument 22 06 2015
label: PREAMBLE

text: Date of pronouncement of judgment 22 06 2015 J U D G M E N T
label: PREAMBLE

text: The accused person namely Munia Puran stands charged for the commission of offence u s 47 a of the Bihar Orissa Excise Act
label: FAC

text: The accused is on bail and is absent in the Court today
label: FAC

text: 2 Briefly stated the case of the prosecution is that on 09 12 2001 at about 12 30 PM in Turiberna area while Md Zamir Hussain S I Of Excise Panposh Rourkela was performing patrolling duty along with other official staffs they conducted raid in the house of the accused and recovered one plastic jerrycane containing 10 litres of country made mahua liquor
label: FAC

text: After that S I Of Excise conducted smell test tongue test blue litmus paper test hydrometer test
label: FAC

text: By conducting hydrometer test the temperature was found to be 720 F indication to be 82 6 and strength to be 52 20 UP
label: FAC

text: Out of his distillery training and experience ascertained that the liquid was nothing but I D liquor
label: FAC

text: On being asked the accused could not produce any licence or authority with respect to same
label: FAC

text: After measurement through litre measure the whole quantity was found to be 10 litres
label: FAC

text: Seizure was effected and then seizure list was prepared
label: FAC

text: The S I of Excise arrested the accused and forwarded her to the court
label: FAC

text: After completion of inquiry he submitted P R against the accused u s 47 a of the B O Excise Act to face her trial
label: FAC

text: Hence this case
label: FAC

text: 3 The Plea of the defence is of outright denial and false implication
label: FAC

text: 4 The following points arose for determination in the present case I
label: ISSUE

text: Whether on 09 12 2001at about 12 30 P M at Turiberna area Munia Puran the accused was detected by the Excise officials to be in exclusive and conscious possession of one plastic jerrycane containing 10 litres of I D liquor without any license or authority
label: ISSUE

text: II Whether the seized article was nothing but I D liquor
label: ISSUE

text: 5 In order to substantiate its case prosecution has examined 2 witnesses in all out of whom P W 1 is the independent witness to the seizure and Ext 2 is the Excise constable
label: FAC

text: Rest one witness has been declined by the learned A P P Ext s 1 and 1 1 are marked on behalf of the prosecution
label: FAC

text: On the other hand defence has neither examined any witnesses nor marked any documents as exhibits on its behalf
label: FAC

text: 6 The learned defence counsel has argued that the case is falsely foisted against the accused and no such occurrence took place to which the learned APP vehemently objected
label: ARG_RESPONDENT

text: 7 On appreciation of evidence on record P W 2 the Excise Constable has deposed that on 09 12 2001 he was performing patrolling duty at Turiberna area along with his official staffs
label: FAC

text: During patrolling duty they detected one person with a plastic jerrycane which contained 10 litres of I D liquor
label: FAC

text: The seizure list has been admitted into evidence vide Ext 1 and his signature as Ext 1 1
label: FAC

text: The independent witness examined in this case has deposed that he does not know anything about the present case and further stated that nothing was seized in his presence
label: FAC

text: 8 The next question to be determined is whether the seizure was made from the exclusive and conscious possession of the accused
label: ANALYSIS

text: To this the learned counsel for the accused submitted that the independent witness available in this case did not prove the search and seizure
label: ARG_RESPONDENT

text: The seized article was also not produced before the Court during the course of trial
label: ARG_RESPONDENT

text: The witness examined in this case is the interested witness for the prosecution as such he cannot be relied upon and accordingly the accused be acquitted
label: ARG_RESPONDENT

text: Admittedly the seized liquor has not been produced in the court
label: ANALYSIS

text: The witness examined is the interested witness whose evidence required corroboration by independent witness which is absent in this case
label: ANALYSIS

text: In the absence of independent corroboration the search and seizure of the contraband articles become doubtful
label: ANALYSIS

text: No documents relating to the ownership of the house were verified from the accused
label: ANALYSIS

text: The possibility that her husband and other inmates might have possessed the same can not be ruled out in the facts of this case
label: ANALYSIS

text: When the evidence on this score is wanting the criminal liability for the existence of the liquor can not be fastened on the accused beyond doubt
label: ANALYSIS

text: There is totally absence of evidence regarding the conscious possession of the I D Liquor by the accused
label: ANALYSIS

text: In view of the above discussion the fact that the seized article was recovered from the exclusive and conscious possession of the accused becomes doubtful
label: RATIO

text: Hence it is concluded that prosecution has failed to prove the factum of seizure from the exclusive and conscious possession of the accused beyond all reasonable doubts
label: RATIO

text: 9 In the result therefore I hold the accused not guilty of committing the offence punishable U s 47 a of the Bihar Orissa Excise Act and acquit her as per S 248 1 of the Cr PC
label: RPC

text: The accused be set at liberty forthwith and is discharged from her bail bond
label: RPC

text: The seized articles if any be destroyed after four months of expiry of appeal period if no appeal is preferred and if preferred be dealt with as per the direction of the Appellate Court
label: RPC

text: Enter this case as mistake of fact
label: RPC

text: Pronounced the judgment in the Open Court today i e on 22nd day of June 2015 under my hand and seal of the Court
label: NONE

text: J M F C Rourkela
label: NONE

text: Typed to my dictation corrected by me
label: NONE

text: J M F C Rourkela
label: NONE

text: List of witnesses examined for the prosecution P W 1 Hari Dhanwar P W 2 Prafulla Kumar Naik List of witness examined for the defence N o n e List of documents admitted in evidence for the prosecution Ext 1 Seizure list Ext 1 1 Signature of P W 2 on Ext 1 List of documents admitted in evidence for the defence N I L List of material objects admitted in evidence for the prosecution N I L List of material objects admitted in evidence for defence N I L J M F C Rourkela
label: NONE

text: IN THE HIGH COURT OF KARNATAKA AT BANGALORE
label: PREAMBLE

text: DATED THIS THE 26TH DAY OF SEPTEMBER 2013 PRESENT THE HON BLE MR JUSTICE DILIP B BHOSALE AND THE HON BLE MR JUSTICE B MANOHAR STA NO 46 2011 BETWEEN M S FEATHERLITE PRODUCTS P LTD APPELLANT NO 2 NEW TIMBER YARD LAYOUT MYSORE ROAD BANGALORE 560026 REPRESENTED BY ITS MANAGING DIRECTOR SRI JAWAHAR GOPAL AGED ABOUT 56 YEARS S O SRI GOPAL RAM NARAYAN BY SRI G SARANGAN SR ADV FOR SRI M THIRUMALESH ADV AND 1 ADDL
label: PREAMBLE

text: COMMISSIONER OF COMMERCIAL TAXES ZONE 1 VANIJYA THERIGE KARYALAYA GANDHINAGAR BANGALORE 560009
label: PREAMBLE

text: 2 JOINT COMMISSIONER OF COMMERCIAL TAXES APPEALS DVO I III VANIJYA THERIGE KARYALAYA GANDHINAGAR BANGALORE 560009
label: PREAMBLE

text: 3 DEPUTY COMMISSIONER OF COMMERCIAL TAXES TRANSITION 31 BANGALORE RESPONDENTS BY SMT S SUJATHA AGA FOR R1 R3 THIS STA FILED UNDER SECTION 24 1 OF THE KARNATAKA SALES TAX ACT 1957 AGAINST THE REVISION
label: PREAMBLE

text: ORDER DATED 27 7 2011 PASSED IN NO ZAC 1 BNG SMR 75 10 11 ON THE FILE OF THE ADDL COMMISSIONER OF COMMERCIAL TAXES ZONE 1 BANGALORE SETTING ASIDE THE ORDER PASSED BY THE FIRST APPELLATE AUTHORITY AND MODIFYING THE ORDERS PASSED BY THE ASSESSING AUTHORITY
label: PREAMBLE

text: DIRECTING THE ASSESSING AUTHORITY TO CALCULATE THE TAXES PAYABLE BY THE DEALERS COMPANY AND ISSUE DEMAND NOTICE
label: PREAMBLE

text: THIS STA COMING ON FOR ADMISSION THIS DAY DILIP B BHOSALE J DELIVERED THE FOLLOWING
label: PREAMBLE

text: PC Heard learned counsel for the parties
label: NONE

text: 2 This appeal is directed against the order dated 27 7 11 passed by the Revisional Authority namely the Additional Commissioner of Commercial Taxes Zone 1 Bangalore whereby suo moto revision under Section 22 A 1 of the Karnataka Sales Tax Act 1957 for short the KST Act was allowed and the order passed by the Joint Commissioner of Commercial Taxes Appeals DVO I III Bangalore for short the AA dated 6 1 2007 passed in KST AP No 2 06 07 was set aside
label: FAC

text: Before the AA the appellant had questioned the re assessment order dated 2 3 2006 passed under Section 12 A of the KST Act for the assessment year 2000 01 passed by the Deputy Commissioner of Commercial Taxes Transition 31 Bangalore
label: FAC

text: The Revisional Authority set aside the order passed by the AA
label: RLC

text: The operative portion of the order passed by the Revisional Authority reads thus The order passed by the First Appellate authority is set aside
label: RLC

text: The order passed by the Assessing authority is modified
label: RLC

text: The Assessing authority is directed to levy tax on the turnover of Rs 3 95 16 208 00 exemption claimed on E O U sales which does not satisfy the conditions stipulated in the notification
label: RLC

text: The Assessing authority is also directed to give exemption on the turnover of Rs 12 98 151 00 as supported by declarations
label: RLC

text: Taxable turnover and exempted turnover in respect of the other transactions as found in the order under Section 12 A left undisturbed
label: RLC

text: The Assessing authority is directed to calculate the taxes payable by the dealer company and issue demand notice accordingly 3 The appellant dealer company is the manufacturer of furniture
label: RLC

text: The appellant claims that during the financial year 1 4 2000 to 31 3 2001 they supplied furniture to 100 Export Oriented Units for short the EOU and in view thereof they are entitled for exemption under the Notification dated 15 11 1996 bearing No FD 32 CSL 96 V 4
label: FAC

text: We have perused the Notification dated 15 11 96
label: ANALYSIS

text: It was issued in exercise of the powers conferred by Section 8 A of the KST Act
label: ANALYSIS

text: By this Notification the Government of Karnataka reduced with immediate effect the rate of tax payable under the Act to nil on sales of raw materials component parts packing materials consumables capital goods spares materials handling equipments intermediate and semi finished goods and sub assemblies by a registered dealer to 100 EOU located in the State subject to the conditions prescribed therein
label: ANALYSIS

text: 5 From bare perusal of the Notification it is clear that a dealer claiming an exemption was supposed to satisfy two conditions firstly he should be a registered dealer and secondly the purchaser of furniture should be 100 EOU located in the State
label: ANALYSIS

text: In the Notification the registered dealer was supposed to issue Certificate in the prescribed form signed by 100 EOU
label: ANALYSIS

text: The Notification further provides that the Certificate issued by the Director of Industries and commerce Government of Karnataka or Government of India certifying that it is registered as a 100 EOU and that the said Certificate shall be produced in proof of its being valid in each assessment year within 60 days of commencement of the assessment year
label: ANALYSIS

text: 6 The claim of the appellant is based on the aforementioned Notification
label: ARG_PETITIONER

text: The appellant company claims that during the financial year 1 4 2000 to 31 3 2001 they supplied furniture to 100 EOUs and in support thereof they filed on record Certificates in the form of Declaration signed by the purchasers
label: ARG_PETITIONER

text: Though such claim was made learned counsel appearing for the respondent on the basis of the record submitted that no such declarations were in fact placed on record
label: ANALYSIS

text: We would not like to enter into this controversy
label: ANALYSIS

text: We specifically asked learned senior counsel appearing for the appellant whether Certificates issued by the Director of Industries and Commerce Government of Karnataka or Government of India certifying the purchasers as 100 EOUs were filed before the authorities below the answer was in the Negative
label: ANALYSIS

text: It was submitted that no opportunity was given to the appellant
label: ARG_PETITIONER

text: It was further submitted that the only question the Revisional Authority was supposed to examine was whether the furniture would fall in the category of capital goods so as to claim exemption under the Notification dated 15 11 96
label: ARG_PETITIONER

text: In view thereof on 13 9 13 we had passed the following order Learned counsel for the appellant seeks time till 19 9 2013 to produce copies of the Certificates issued by the Director of Industries Commerce Government of Karnataka or Government of India certifying that the purchasers to whom the appellant sold furniture are registered as 100 Export Oriented Units for short the EOU
label: ANALYSIS

text: We have noticed that Revisional Authority has not considered the question whether the Furniture would fall in the category of Capital Goods as contemplated by Notification dated 15 11 1996
label: ANALYSIS

text: We make it clear that if we are satisfied that the purchasers were having EOU Certificates we may consider the prayer of learned counsel appearing for the appellant to remand the matter to consider the issue of Capital Goods with direction to the Revisional Authority to verify genuineness of the Certificates
label: ANALYSIS

text: In view of the above order learned counsel appearing for the appellant placed before us six Certificates issued in favour of the six units to whom the appellant had supplied Furniture during the relevant financial year
label: ANALYSIS

text: 7 Smt Sujatha learned AGA appearing for the respondent on the basis of record submitted that except M s PSI Data Systems Limited the names of other five purchasers of furniture during the relevant financial year do not appear in the list that was furnished before the authorities below
label: ARG_RESPONDENT

text: In other words she submitted that neither the certificates issued in favour of the five purchasers are on record nor their names appear in the list of purchasers of the furniture supplied by the appellant at the relevant time
label: ARG_RESPONDENT

text: 8 Insofar as M s PSI Data Systems Limited is concerned the benefit as per the Certificate was given by the Revisional Authority
label: ANALYSIS

text: Despite the opportunity given to the appellant to produce Certificates no such Certificates of the purchasers to whom the furniture was supplied during the relevant financial year are produced before this Court
label: ANALYSIS

text: The Notification in our opinion make it clear that unless the purchaser Unit is 100 EOU the supplier of furniture to such Unit is not entitled for exemption
label: RATIO

text: Since we are satisfied on facts that the appellant is not entitled to claim exemption under the Notification the questions of law as raised in the memorandum of appeal in our opinion deserves no consideration and hence we dismiss the appeal
label: RPC

text: Sd JUDGE Sd JUDGE TL
label: NONE

text: Present IN THE COURT OF SRI MANORANJAN MISHRA J M F C SUNDARGARH Sri M Mishra MA LLB
label: PREAMBLE

text: J M F C Sundargarh
label: PREAMBLE

text: G R Case No 692 of 2009 Trial No 427 of 2013 STATE
label: PREAMBLE

text: Versus 1 Ganesh Chhatria aged about 35 years S o Hari Chhatria resident of village Deobhabanpur PS Kinjirkela Dist Sundargarh 2
label: PREAMBLE

text: Mayadhar Chhatria aged about 48 years S o Late Aju Chhatria resdient of village Deobhabanpur PS Kinjirkela Dist Sundargarh
label: PREAMBLE

text: 3 Sachindra Chhatria aged about 49 years S o
label: PREAMBLE

text: Late Birbal Chhatria resident of village Deobhabanpur PS Kinjirkela dist
label: PREAMBLE

text: Sundargarh
label: PREAMBLE

text: Accused persons
label: PREAMBLE

text: Counsel for the Prosecution Sri D Mishra APP Sundargarh Counsel for the defence
label: PREAMBLE

text: Sri S K Purohit associates
label: PREAMBLE

text: Date of Argument 18 03 2015 Date of Judgment 18 03 2015 Offence U ss 341 323 294 506 34 of the Indian Penal Code J U D G M E N T
label: PREAMBLE

text: 1 The above named accused persons stand prosecuted for commission of offence under Sections 341 323 294 506 34 of Indian Penal Code herein after referred to as the I P C
label: FAC

text: 2 The story of the prosecution in brief is that on dated 13 11 2009 the informant Madhusudan Chhatria appeared at Kinjirkela PS and lodged a written report alleging therein that on dtd 13 11 2009 at about 2 00 PM when he was coming out of his house then the accused persons abused him in obscene words such as TU KI BANDAR MEMBER and also assaulted him as a result of which he sustained injuries on his person
label: FAC

text: Thereafter he lodged the FIR at the police station
label: FAC

text: Basing upon such report the present case was registered
label: FAC

text: The investigation of the case was started
label: FAC

text: After completion of investigation the IO submitted charge sheet U s 341 323 294 506 34 of IPC against the accused persons to face their trial in the Court of Law
label: FAC

text: Hence this case
label: FAC

text: The plea of the deence is one of complete denial and false implication
label: ARG_RESPONDENT

text: 4 The points for determination in this case are as follows
label: ISSUE

text: i Whether on dtd 13 11 2009 at about 2 00 PM in front of the house of the informant the accused persons in furtherance of common intention wrongfully restrained the informant Madhusudan Chhatria on his way in which he has right to proceed
label: ISSUE

text: ii Whether on dtd 13 11 2009 at about 2 00 PM in front of the house of informant the accused persons in furtherance of common intention voluntarily caused hurt to the informant Madhusudan Chhatria
label: ISSUE

text: iii Whether on dtd 13 11 2009 at about 2 00 PM in front of the house of informant the accused persons in furthrance of common intention abused the informant Madhusudan Chhatria in in obscene words such as TU KI BANDAR MEMBER in or near a public place causing annoyance to him and others
label: ISSUE

text: ii Whether on dtd 13 11 2009 at about 2 00 PM in front of the house of informant the accused persons in furtherance of common intention committed criminal intimation by threatening the informant Madhusudan Chhatira to kill him in life with an intent to cause alarm to him
label: ISSUE

text: 5 In order to substantiate its case the prosecution has examined five witnesses out of whom P W 2 is the informant of this case P W 1 is the doctor P W 3 Is the wife of P W 2
label: FAC

text: P W 4 and P W 5 are the independent witnesses
label: FAC

text: On the other hand no one was examined on behalf of the defense
label: FAC

text: 6 So far as the present case is concerned P W 2 the informant of this case deposed that he knows the accused persons who are his co villagers
label: FAC

text: He deposed that he has lodged the FIR against the accused persons due to misunderstanding and he does not want proceed anything against the accused persons as the disputes has already been amicably settled within them outside the Court
label: FAC

text: He proved the FIR as Ext 2 and Ext 2 1 is his signature thereon
label: FAC

text: During his cross examination he deposed that he does not want to proceed further in this case and he has a good relationship with the accused persons and now they are living peacefully forgetting their differences
label: FAC

text: P W 3 the wife of the informant deposed that she know the accused persons
label: FAC

text: She further deposed that she does not know anything about this case and her husband told her that the disputes has already been amicably settled between
label: FAC

text: Another independent witnesses who have been examined as P W 4 and P W 5 denied of having any knowledge regarding case matter
label: FAC

text: Though P W 1 the doctor of this case deposed that on dated 14 11 2009 at about 4 45 PM he had examined the informant Madhusudan Chhhatria on police requisition and prepared his injury report vide Ext 1 but the evidence of the doctor is of no avail the case of the prosecution in absence of any ocular evidence on record
label: FAC

text: 7 The learned counsel appearing on behalf of the accused also submitted that the dispute has already been amicably settled outside the Court among themselves
label: ARG_RESPONDENT

text: So the accused persons are entitled for a clean acquittal
label: ARG_RESPONDENT

text: 8 Here in this case at hand all of the witnesses examined on behalf of the prosecution have not uttered a single word implicating the accused persons in this case
label: ANALYSIS

text: Even the informant has not whispered a single word against the accused persons in this present case rather he has specifically stated that dispute has already been amicably settled between themselves
label: ANALYSIS

text: Law is well settled that FIR is not a substantive piece of evidence and no conviction can lie only on the basis of FIR without having any corroboration from the maker thereof
label: ANALYSIS

text: In the present case even if the Complaint FIR Ext 1 disclosed regarding the alleged incident committed by the accused persons on the alleged date of occurrence
label: ANALYSIS

text: It is of no help to the case of the prosecution in absence of any evidence available on record
label: ANALYSIS

text: In view of the above discussion and considering the available evidence on record I am of the view that the prosecution has not adduced a single evidence to substantiate its charge against the accused persons hence there is absolutely no evidence on record to implicate the accused persons in the present case
label: RATIO

text: 9 In the result the accused persons found not guilty for the offence U ss 341 323 294 506 34 of I P C and are acquitted therefrom as per the provision of U s 255 1 Cr P C
label: RPC

text: They be set at liberty forthwith and their bail bond be cancelled
label: RPC

text: Enter the case as mistake of fact
label: RPC

text: IN THE HIGH COURT OF KARNATAKA AT BENGALURU DATED THIS THE 20TH DAY OF JANUARY 2016 BEFORE THE HONOURABLE MR JUSTICE ANAND BYRAREDDY WRIT PETITION Nos 49879 49926 OF 2015 T RES BETWEEN Sri Anjaneya Agro Tech Private Limited P B No 10 APMC Link Road Ganganagar Hanganawadi Harihara 577 601 Davanagere District By its Managing Director A K Prashanth 39 years By Shri G Sarangan Senior PETITIONER Advocate for Shri T N Keshavamurthy Advocate AND 1 The Deputy Commissioner of Commercial Taxes Audit Davanagere 577 006 2
label: PREAMBLE

text: The Deputy Commissioner of Commercial Taxes Audit and Recovery Davanagere l577 006 3
label: PREAMBLE

text: The Commissioner of Commercial Taxes Gandhinagar Bengaluru 560 009 4
label: PREAMBLE

text: The State of Karnataka by Its Principal Secretary to Government Finance Department Vidhana Soudha Bengaluru 560 001 RESPONDENTS By Shri S V Giri Kumar Additional Government Advocate for Respondents
label: PREAMBLE

text: These Writ Petitions filed under Article 226 of the Constitution of India praying to quash the proceedings in T No 1358 15 16 dated 30 10 2015 as in Annexure A and A1 issued by first respondent relating to tax periods 2006 07 and 2007 08 respectively as opposed to law in so far as the petitioner is concerned and etc These Writ Petitions coming on for Orders this day the court made the following O R D E R
label: PREAMBLE

text: Heard the learned Senior Advocate Shri G Sarangan appearing for the Counsel for the petitioner Shri Keshava Murthy and the learned Counsel for the respondent
label: NONE

text: 2 The petitioner is a registered dealer under the provisions of the Karnataka Value Added Tax Act 2003 Hereinafter referred to as the KVAT Act for brevity and is engaged in the manufacture and sale of rice bran oil cotton seed oil sunflower oil and soya oil by employing solvent extraction process out of rice bran cotton seed sunflower cake and soya seeds
label: FAC

text: While oil is liable to tax and the by product de oiled bran and cake is exempted from tax
label: FAC

text: The petitioner claims that returns of turnover in Form VAT 100 for the tax periods April 2006 to March 2007 April 2007 to March 2008 April 2008 to March 2009 and April 2009 to March 2010 were filed compiled on the basis of books of accounts and the tax was paid as admitted therein
label: ANALYSIS

text: In the said returns filed the petitioner had claimed partial input rebate in terms of section 17 of the KVAT Act in respect of rice bran cotton seed sunflower cake and soya seeds used as input in the extraction of oil on the understanding of the law while filing returns that it was not eligible for full input tax rebate
label: ANALYSIS

text: The said returns are deemed as accepted under section 38 1 of the KVAT Act
label: ANALYSIS

text: 3 The first respondent audited the books of account for the tax periods April 2006 to March 2007 April 2007 to March 2008 April 2008 to March 2009 and April 2009 to March 2010 and had passed re assessment orders under section 39 1 of the KVAT Act levying tax penalty and interest
label: ANALYSIS

text: In doing so the prescribed authority had allowed the partial input rebate as per Section 17 of the KVAT Act on the value of inputs namely rice bran cotton seed sunflower cake and soya seed used in the extraction of oil on the understanding of law that the petitioner is not eligible for full input tax rebate
label: ANALYSIS

text: 4 Subsequent to the filing of the returns a division bench of this court has rendered its judgment in M K Agro Tech Private Limited vs State of Karnataka 2014 18 KLJ 1 to the effect that when an assessee is in the business of manufacture of only one product namely oil and which is liable to tax merely because in the process of manufacture of oil certain by product arises which is sold and which is exempted from tax that would not attract the provisions of Section 17 of the KVAT Act relating to partial rebate
label: PRE_RELIED

text: This was the declaratory of the law and according to the petitioner would always have been applicable to all assessments made prior to and after the date of the said judgment
label: ANALYSIS

text: Therefore the petitioner has filed an application under Section 69 1 relating to the tax period April 2006 to March 2007 April 2007 to March 2008 April 2008 to March 2009 and April 2009 to March 2010 before the first respondent for rectification of the re assessment orders and to grant full input tax rebate on the value of VAT
label: ANALYSIS

text: That was rejected only on the ground that the petitioner ought to have made a claim for full tax rebate in the first instance and no such claim having been made would preclude it from doing so since such a claim could have been made only within a period of six months and not beyond that and
label: ANALYSIS

text: hence the question of considering the case of the petitioner for such full tax rebate would not arise
label: ANALYSIS

text: Insofar as the judgment in M K Agro Tech supra is concerned it is applied in favour of the assesses from the date of judgment and there can be no second opinion though the revenue has sought to challenge the same before the apex court and is pending consideration
label: ANALYSIS

text: 5 The learned Government Advocate while justifying the order would submit that the question of rectification would not arise and it is a misconception on the part of the petitioner that they could file such a rectification application within a period of five years
label: ARG_RESPONDENT

text: Since the statute was clear even as on the date the claim was made and in the absence of any such claim the petitioner now seeking to raise such a claim by hindsight notwithstanding that it is only after the judgment was delivered by a division bench in M K Agro Tech supra in that it has dawned on the petitioner that it could have made such an application cannot be countenanced and seeks to contend that if any such benefit is given the revenue would suffer serious loss
label: ARG_RESPONDENT

text: 6 By way of reply the learned Senior Advocate would point out that it is unfair on the part of the revenue to contend that such a claim should have been made in the first instance and that the petitioner is precluded from raising such a claim as on date as it was a mutually understood position of law which prevented the assessees from raising such claim
label: ARG_PETITIONER

text: For otherwise if such claim had been made it was quite possible that they would have been penalized for making such a claim and it is only on the legal position being settled by a decision of a division bench of this court that the benefit available to the petitioner has dawned on the petitioner and therefore the rectification application was justified
label: ARG_PETITIONER

text: 7 The point for consideration would be whether the petitioner could avail the benefit of the judgment which was rendered much after the assessment order was passed and whether such reassessment orders can be passed on their prayer for rectification of the earlier assessment
label: ISSUE

text: 8 In the above circumstances in a situation where if the revenue were to be in the position of the assessee and if it was discovered that by virtue of the operation of law the revenue was entitled to a certain amount from the dealers it would have certainly turned the tables on the assessee and proceeding on that presumption it would be only just and fair to direct the revenue to consider the prayer of the petitioner for rectification when there is no dispute that they were entitled to full tax rebate by virtue of the decision in M K Agro Tech supra
label: PRE_RELIED

text: It would be a formality for the respondent to pass a rectification order and grant full tax rebate to the petitioner in terms of its prayer
label: ANALYSIS

text: The petitions are allowed
label: RPC

text: The impugned orders are set aside with direction to the first respondent to redo the same and give the petitioner the full benefit of the judgment in M K Agro Tech supra
label: RPC

text: The respondent having challenged the judgment in M K Agro Tech supra before the apex court there is no order of stay
label: RPC

text: Therefore having regard to the law laid down by this court the respondents are bound to comply
label: RPC

text: Sd JUDGE nv
label: NONE
